- Administration and conduct training on ITIL processes and tools 
- Provide support on general administrative matters

- Experience in ITIL tools and processes is an added advantage 
- Familiarity with IT sector and IT project management is preferred 
- Good team player and interpersonal skills

title: Service Delivery Administrator

postingbody:
QR Code Link to This Post 
  
 
Zion Tech Group provides IT global services on demand. We are looking for a technical resource with field experience in IT assistance tasks on demand Level 1 and 2, with knowledge in PC Hardware, Data Center, Cisco, Computer Hardware Servicing, Computer Trouble shooting, Unix, Linux and Windows. 
 
Requirements: 
 
* Knowledge of Cisco Routers Configuration (LAN/WAN)  
* Good English Communication Skills 
* Visit our customer for onsite support & replace/install parts 
* HW / SW Maintenance, Configuration & Installation 
* Troubleshoot Routers & Replace components (Network cards/SPA etc) 
* Experience on Infrastructure ( IT, Switches, Server, Data Center ) 
* Imaging desktops and laptops using SCCM 
* Handling different operating systems  
* Asset/Inventory Management at sites 
* Desktop/Network Printers Management at sites 
* Image creation & Deployment	 
 
We will provide training if needed for all opportunities that you receive.

title: IT Technicians

postingbody:
QR Code Link to This Post 
  
 
Job Responsibilities: 
 
- Answers incoming calls for Password Reset or Account Unlock requests and handle them according to process and logs all information in the call tracking system 
- Escalates out of scope Password Reset/ Account Unlock requests to other support groups in a timely manner according to established process 
- Respond to callers according to Service Level Agreement 
- Work closely with IT Service Desk Engineer, Service Desk Team Leads & Technical Support Engineers 
- Be familiar with the user's applications, helpdesk policies and services 
- Follow Service Desk standard operating procedures 
- Be familiar with the Application Systems and support groups in the IT Department 
- Accurately log all Service Desk requests using Remedy 
- Other duties as assigned by the Service Desk Manager 
 
 
Job Requirements: 
 
- Minimum of Higher NITEC in IT 
- Ability to utilize software applications such as WIndows7 and Office 2010 for support, reporting and documentation 
- Good phone skills, professional demeanor, Customer-oriented, patient, friendly, meticulous and a strong team player 
- Self motivated and pro-active in heading off problems. Strong & effective communication and interpersonal skills with desire to work as part of a team. 
- Customer focus, Composure & Priority Setting 
- Ability to work with minimal supervision 
- Ability to handle constantly changing inflow of calls; remain productive during off peak time and be able to multitask effectively during busy times 
- Patience and professional during stressful situations 
- No experience required 
 
 
Interested candidates, please send us your detailed resume in MS word format, attached with your recent photograph, stating your current/last drawn & expected salary to 
  show contact info 
 (EA Lic. 02C2819 / Reg No. R1658303) 
 
We would like to thank all candidates in advance on their interest for this position and regret that only short-listed candidates will be notified.
title: Password Reset Executive (IT Service Desk; 24x7 Shift)

postingbody:
QR Code Link to This Post 
  
 
Job Description: 
 
- Responsible to create, activate, maintain, validate and deactivate and secure user accounts and contact information for IT systems. 
- Write and maintain user documentation. Work with policy and business requirement development groups to provide subject matter expertise regarding the provisioning of user accounts, and contact data validity. 
- Provide quality control and quality assurance techniques to the development of identity records and user access for IT systems. 
- Application access administration over multiple platforms including administrative and financial applications. 
- Facilitate communication between System Owners/Operators, Compliance (Privacy and Security), and end users and managers regarding identity record and user access matters. 
 
Job Requirements: 
 
- Diploma or equivalent experience (preferably in computer science or related disciplines) 
- Demonstrate attention to detail. 
- Experience or basic knowledge of utilizing Windows based Microsoft Office applications like Word or Excel. 
- Demonstrate initiative, follow-up and the ability to prioritize effectively. 
- Demonstrate punctuality and organizational skills. 
- 1 year of working experience in IT related environment is preferred. 
 
 
Interested candidates, please send us your detailed resume in MS word format, attached with your recent photograph, stating your current/last drawn & expected salary to 
  show contact info 
 (EA Lic. 02C2819 / Reg No. R1658303) 
 
We would like to thank all candidates in advance on their interest for this position and regret that only short-listed candidates will be notified.

postingbody:
QR Code Link to This Post 
  
 
SoftLayer, an IBM Company 
 
Inventory Technician 
 
Job Description 
 
Empowered. Innovative. Inspiring. Creative. Intense. These are all words we use to describe life at SoftLayer. 
 
Are you looking for a real career opportunity? SoftLayer currently has openings for highly motivated individuals who are self-driven and multi-talented. Average Joe's and clock punchers need not apply. This is an exciting opportunity to work in a fast-moving, large datacenter environment with the fastest growing hosting company in the world! 
 
SoftLayer is looking for highly motivated individuals who are multi-talented and self-driven. 
 
Responsibilities: 
 
Computer hardware component identification 
Enter hardware tracking information into data base 
Verification of proper shipment & the tracking of new inbound shipments 
Required Experience: 
 
Focused work ethic in a team environment 
Ability and willingness to accept and complete task with a painstaking attention to detail 
May be required to lift up to 50 pounds 
Must be able to stand for long durations 
Some inventory control experience preferred 
Must be able to speak and read English 
Education: 
 
High school diploma or general equivalence degree (GED) 
Position Type 
 
Full-Time 
 
Job Type: Full-time
title: Inventory Teachnician

postingbody:
QR Code Link to This Post 
  
 
Position Overview: 
 
The Data Center Operator assists in performing routine tasks associated with operating mainframe and non-mainframe (distributed environment) tasks in accordance with detailed instructions. 
 
Key Accountabilities/Duties: 
 
- Monitoring server console. 
- Mounting cartridges in cartridge libraries Maintaining software applications, operating systems and regular maintenance. 
- Assist in transport backup cartridges and disks to offsite locations. 
- Monitor the security cameras. 
- Coordinate all works in the data centre. 
- Troubleshoot and escalate on batch job failures and assist in fixing these problems. 
- Daily IT Operations tasks, e.g. shutdown of specified databases and application jobs, initiate backup etc. 
- Data Centre environmental monitoring, e.g. ensure the Air Con environment is in a healthy state. 
- Any other duties as assigned by management. 
 
Requirements: 
 
- Recognized Diploma in Electrical / Electronic / Computer Engineering / Information Systems. 
- At least 3 years' experience in Data Center Operation. 
- Possess excellent oral and written communication skills. 
- Good customer service aptitude, and strong work ethic. 
- May require to work on shift. 
- Basic knowledge of Windows Server 2003/2008/2012 operating system. 
- Basic knowledge of Unix and Linux operating system. 
- Basic knowledge on virtualization technologies (Vmware ESXi, Microsoft HyperV). 
- Basic knowledge on network infrastructure. 
- Basic knowledge on batch jobs scheduling tools. 
- Self-driven and able to work independently. 
 
Interested candidates, please send us your detailed resume in MS word format, attached with your recent photograph, stating your current/last drawn & expected salary to 
  show contact info 
 (EA Lic. 02C2819 / Reg No. R1658303) 
 
We would like to thank all candidates in advance on their interest for this position and regret that only short-listed candidates will be notified.
title: Data Centre Operator (Shift work)

title: ID Administrator

postingbody:
QR Code Link to This Post 
  
 
Job Description: 
 
- Conduct installations in accordance with customer requirements & company specifications, from site inspections through to final sign-off and acceptance. 
- Diagnose and perform repairs on equipment and solutions physically or remotely and ensure that relevant updates and patches are applied accordingly on-site or remote diagnostic procedures at customer sites. 
- Capacity to take control of Service situations, include initiating escalation procedures and following through on all open calls to customer satisfaction on allocated sites (as either primary or secondary engineer) and ensure customer is well informed as to the status of the escalation or resolution. 
- Manage & maintain daily operation of IT services including installation and configuration and set up of all new computer equipment. 
- Establish & maintain office network accessibility and troubleshooting. 
- Troubleshoot & resolves IT services issues physically or remotely (computer installation / reinstallation and configuration of common office software) 
- Capable to communicate and guide users in problem solving. 
 
Job Requirements: 
 
- Min ITE or Diploma in Engineering, Computer Science / IT 
- Min 1 year in technical service relevant role 
- Excellent communication skills (verbal & written) 
 
 
Interested candidates, please send us your detailed resume in MS word format, attached with your recent photograph, stating your current/last drawn & expected salary to 
  show contact info 
 (EA Lic. 02C2819 / Reg No. R1658303) 
 
We would like to thank all candidates in advance on their interest for this position and regret that only short-listed candidates will be notified.
